news.title: Gross asset value of REITs to rise 35-40% by the end of next fiscal: Crisil
news.para: Indian REITs are on the brink of a remarkable transformation. Projections indicate a surge in asset values by 35-40% by fiscal 2027, driven by the acquisition of additional properties and the introduction of new REITs into the marketplace. Rising occupancy rates are set to enhance rental income, contributing to a robust financial backbone.

news.title: Ludhiana development body seals five unauthorized buildings in Threke village
news.para: Greater Ludhiana Area Development Authority (Glada) has sealed five unauthorized buildings in Threke village following notices to developers. Glada is adopting a zero-tolerance approach against illegal constructions and has recommended filing FIRs. Residents are urged to verify approved colonies on the Glada website before purchasing property.

news.title: Delhi government to map all land assets online
news.para: Delhi government is directing all land-owning departments to urgently submit property details for a centralized online database, DAMIS. This initiative aims to strengthen management, prevent encroachments, and create a reliable digital inventory of government assets for better planning and utilization.

news.title: Gmada flags 154 illegal constructions in Mohali
news.para: Gmada has identified 154 unauthorized constructions and submitted an action taken report to the National Green Tribunal.  Notices were issued and action initiated under relevant acts for illegal constructions detected in villages near the Chandigarh boundary. Gmada assured continuous monitoring and strict action against violators.

news.title: Gurugram: Illegal construction go unchecked in Sultanpur National Park buffer zone
news.para: Surveys have identified 232 unauthorized constructions within Sultanpur National Park's eco-sensitive zone and regulated corridors, violating development restrictions. These illegal structures threaten the Ramsar-recognized wetland, a crucial birdwatching site and part of the Central Asian Flyway. Authorities have issued show-cause notices, warning of demolition if non-compliance continues.

news.title: Navi Mumbai international airport starts commercial flight operations
news.para: The Navi Mumbai International Airport is now operational. An IndiGo flight marked its first arrival, followed by the first departure. This new airport expands Mumbai's aviation capacity.  The airport will initially operate for 12 hours daily.

news.title: Jindal Cement steps up expansion, plans four-fold capacity jump
news.para: Jindal Cement is embarking on an exciting journey of growth as it prepares to quadruple its production capacity to 10 million tonnes. This ambitious plan is supported by a considerable investment of approximately ₹3,000 crore over the next two to three years, aimed at enhancing the output from its Raigarh and Angul plants.

news.title: High-end housing developers go for integrated development as homebuyers show preference for convenience
news.para: Of late, developers such as DLF, Hero Realty, M3M, Tribeca and Central Park have been integrating boutique retail developments as part of their projects. According to a JLL study, mixed-use townships are fuelling 35% of residential absorption in major cities by blending living, retail, office and entertainment spaces.

news.title: Pune: MIDC tells four top developers to reduce air, sound pollution in Hinjewadi
news.para: MIDC has issued notices to four real estate developers in Pune's Megapolis area, demanding action against air and sound pollution. Residents have complained about dust and debris from construction trucks, impacting health and daily life. Developers claim compliance but are reportedly implementing additional measures.

news.title: Society NOC must even with civic body nod for construction: Gujarat HC
news.para: The Gujarat High Court has halted construction of a 10-storey building in Vadodara, ruling it violated cooperative housing society bylaws and lacked mandatory NOC. Despite civic authorities granting development permission, the court emphasized that construction within a society must conform to its bylaws and obtain prior consent.

news.title: Bengaluru apartment residents lose electricity over vacant flats’ dues
news.para: Residents of a Bengaluru high-rise faced a day-long power cut due to a Rs 2 lakh dues dispute between Bescom and the builder. Bescom disconnected supply to 150 households over non-payment for 30 empty flats, despite occupied homes having paid their bills. The builder has allegedly absconded without transferring electricity connections or providing essential property documents.

news.title: Government to soon launch SWAMIH-2 fund to complete one lakh homes in stalled projects
news.para: The government is set to unveil the SWAMIH-2 Fund to offer vital last-mile financing to kickstart numerous stalled housing projects, directly aiding nearly 100,000 middle-class families with investments that have been languishing.

news.title: Dehradun: Rispana bank residents await EWS flats amid demolition fears
news.para: Residents of Kathbangla colony face demolition fears as promised EWS flats remain undelivered by the Dehradun Municipal Corporation. Despite NGT-mandated notices for floodplain encroachment, over a month has passed without relocation, leaving families anxious about losing their homes in the cold.

news.title: Now, get survey certificate online through Visakhapatnam civic body site
news.para: The Greater Visakhapatnam Municipal Corporation (GVMC) has launched an online application system for survey certificates for buildings and vacant plots. This new digital platform allows citizens to apply, track, and obtain certificates within seven days, eliminating the need for manual visits to multiple offices.

news.title: Homebuyers in Tamil Nadu to get relief on stamp duty and registration fees
news.para: Tamil Nadu homebuyers registering first-sale apartments and villas will now benefit from a new government order. Stamp duty and registration fees paid on construction agreements before December 1, 2023, can be set off against the composite value of land and building during sale deed registration. This move aims to prevent double payment for buyers and aligns with RERA regulations.

news.title: IT department probes sub-registrar office in Agra over property transaction irregularities
news.para: Income tax officials conducted a review of property registration records at a sub-registrar office in Agra, investigating potential concealment of transactions exceeding Rs 10 lakh without PAN and Rs 30 lakh. Land deeds worth Rs 1,000 crore are under scrutiny, with action to follow for taxpayers found to have underreported or provided defective financial transaction statements.

news.title: Bengaluru: HC order ignored, illegal construction continues in HAL III Stage
news.para: Residents have taken their fight to the High Court after over 40 complaints about alleged building norm violations in HAL III Stage went unaddressed. Despite a court order for the BCCC to issue notices and stop non-compliant construction, residents claim work continues, nearing inauguration and causing significant disruption and safety concerns.

news.title: Ahmedabad: Demolition of 25 houses at Thaltej society begins
news.para: Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation commenced demolishing 25 houses in Snehanjali Society, Thaltej, following prior demolition notices. Residents, after protesting a land dispute, have agreed to temporary relocation in Gujarat Housing Board flats in Naranpura. They've accepted the civic body's and housing board's decisions on rent and financial matters. Most homes have now been razed.

news.title: Punjab CIC pulls up Amritsar civic body over missing records of commercial complex
news.para: The Punjab Information Commissioner has directed an inquiry into Amritsar Municipal Corporation's failure to locate records for a prominent commercial complex. The Commissioner expressed serious concerns over record management and enforcement of building bye-laws, questioning the corporation's ability to retrieve building plans and ensure adequate parking facilities.

news.title: Post- auction, Aviom India Housing Finance promoter tables a full settlement plan
news.para: Aviom India Housing Finance promoter Kajal Ilmi has submitted a revised settlement offer of ₹554 crore upfront, aiming to repay lenders and withdraw bankruptcy proceedings. This comes after Unity Small Finance Bank emerged as the winning bidder in a challenge auction for the company. The proposal includes an equity infusion and aims to maximize value for stakeholders.
